dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_descript: You can use OLA to configure a network interface, and modify the way it works. For example, you can use the interface dedicated to the public network in order to get double connectivity to the OVHcloud private network (vRack).
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_co: The interfaces will be de-configured. Connectivity to your server will be lost while the interface is being configured.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_ob: As part of the OVHcloud Link Aggregation private configuration, your outgoing public bandwidth option will not be used.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_no: The following interfaces cannot be selected for your configuration. To configure them, please remove their vRacks and failover IPs.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_field_mo: OLA can offer different types of interface configuration
The server’s network interfaces are configured as they are on delivery. An interface for the public network (internet), and another interface for the private network (vRack)

The server’s two network interfaces are used for the private network (vRack). Each link has the basic level of bandwidth, or the level you have selected as an option. Please note: With this option, the server will no longer be accessible via its public IP.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_step2_de: Select the interfaces you would like to group together.
Select the aggregated link you would like to ungroup.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_error: An error has occurred during configuration: {{ errorMessage }}
